page.title: 02Ecology: Stowmarket Area.
page.content: As in many other parts of the country, woods, hedges and ponds have been lost as a result of an increase in arable farming and especially of "prairie" farming, which involves very large fields. However there are still many items of interest, a detailed account of which can be found in the ECOLOGICAL SURVEY of Suffolk, conducted by Suffolk County Council and the Suffolk Trust for Nature Conservation in 1984. Interesting features include:- 1.The headwaters of the River Gipping the river meanders through wet grazing meadows. 2.The moat around the historic Columbine Hall. 3.Stowupland Green had a variety of interesting plants, but frequent mowings stopped these from seeding. Lady's Smock has survived.(continued).
